segments.content: Hi everyone!
segments.sourceMdx: Hi everyone!

segments.content: We have some nice articles this week. I liked to discover how React-Query is implemented, or the latest Storybook news.

segments.content: [![FlyCode Makes React Apps Editable without coding, Git based](/emails/issues/124/flycode.jpg)](https://bit.ly/3UPwAoJ)
segments.sourceMdx: [![FlyCode Makes React Apps Editable without coding, Git based](/emails/issues/124/flycode.jpg)](https://bit.ly/3UPwAoJ)

segments.content: **[FlyCode Makes React Apps Editable without coding, Git based](https://bit.ly/3UPwAoJ)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[FlyCode Makes React Apps Editable without coding, Git based](https://bit.ly/3UPwAoJ)**

segments.content: [FlyCode](https://bit.ly/3wWSi00) (YC S22) makes React web apps editable in minutes so Product and UX teams can iterate and release products faster, so they don't have to wait on (or consume) developer time.
segments.sourceMdx: [FlyCode](https://bit.ly/3wWSi00) (YC S22) makes React web apps editable in minutes so Product and UX teams can iterate and release products faster, so they don't have to wait on (or consume) developer time.

segments.content: FlyCode reads your regular React code and finds Texts, Images, Design tokens and Analytics event, then it let's non-coders collaborate and edit them and send back a pull request (they don't need access to GitHub!)
segments.sourceMdx: FlyCode reads your regular React code and finds Texts, Images, Design tokens and Analytics event, then it let's non-coders collaborate and edit them and send back a pull request (they don't need access to GitHub!)

segments.content:
* Saves development time
* No code integration, it just reads your code!
* GitHub based, a bot is scanning the code and creates pull requests
* Use your own stack and components
* Retain codebase ownership
segments.sourceMdx:
- Saves development time
- No code integration, it just reads your code!
- GitHub based, a bot is scanning the code and creates pull requests
- Use your own stack and components
- Retain codebase ownership

segments.content: You can get started here: [flycode.com/developers](https://www.flycode.com/developers)

segments.content: ## ‚öõÔ∏è React
segments.sourceMdx: ## ‚öõÔ∏è React {#react}

segments.content: **[Nextra 2.0](https://nextra.site/)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Nextra 2.0](https://nextra.site/)**

segments.content: Nextra is a tool to facilitate the creation of documentation sites, based on Next.js, and created by a Vercel engineer. v2 has just been released with a great redesign and a nice list of features (MDX 2, Tailwind, search, i18n, a11y, code highlighting...). Relying on Next.js allows to benefit from a modern infrastructure and the latest Next.js innovations, but also to create more dynamic pages (SSR, ISR) associated to static documentation pages. It is a very serious competitor to [Docusaurus](https://docusaurus.io/), the tool I am working on.
segments.sourceMdx: Nextra is a tool to facilitate the creation of documentation sites, based on Next.js, and created by a Vercel engineer. v2 has just been released with a great redesign and a nice list of features (MDX 2, Tailwind, search, i18n, a11y, code highlighting...). Relying on Next.js allows to benefit from a modern infrastructure and the latest Next.js innovations, but also to create more dynamic pages (SSR, ISR) associated to static documentation pages. It is a very serious competitor to [Docusaurus](https://docusaurus.io/), the tool I am working on.

segments.content: [![Nextra 2.0](/emails/issues/127/nextra.jpg)](https://nextra.site/)
segments.sourceMdx: [![Nextra 2.0](/emails/issues/127/nextra.jpg)](https://nextra.site/)

segments.content: **[Inside React Query](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/inside-react-query)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Inside React Query](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/inside-react-query)**

segments.content: Dominik explains how React-Query works, and details the relationships between its different elements: QueryClient, QueryCache, Query, Persister, QueryObserver... Many of these elements do not depend on React, and this is what allows TanStack Query to easily support other frameworks like SolidJS thanks to adapters.
segments.sourceMdx: Dominik explains how React-Query works, and details the relationships between its different elements: QueryClient, QueryCache, Query, Persister, QueryObserver... Many of these elements do not depend on React, and this is what allows TanStack Query to easily support other frameworks like SolidJS thanks to adapters.

segments.content: [![Inside React Query](/emails/issues/127/react-query.png)](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/inside-react-query)
segments.sourceMdx: [![Inside React Query](/emails/issues/127/react-query.png)](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/inside-react-query)

segments.content: **[NextJS, SvelteKit, Remix and the future of Storybook](https://storybook.js.org/blog/framework-api/)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[NextJS, SvelteKit, Remix and the future of Storybook](https://storybook.js.org/blog/framework-api/)**

segments.content: Storybook 7.0 will have a new Framework API. It will allow the creation of "Framework packages" (example: `@storybook/nextjs`) that pre-configure your Storybook for a given stack (builder, renderer, app settings), and that you can extend. The support of several frameworks based on Vite is ready. Next.js and SvelteKit frameworks are coming soon, and a Remix support is considered.
segments.sourceMdx: Storybook 7.0 will have a new Framework API. It will allow the creation of "Framework packages" (example: `@storybook/nextjs`) that pre-configure your Storybook for a given stack (builder, renderer, app settings), and that you can extend. The support of several frameworks based on Vite is ready. Next.js and SvelteKit frameworks are coming soon, and a Remix support is considered.

segments.content: [![NextJS, SvelteKit, Remix and the future of Storybook](/emails/issues/127/storybook-frameworks.png)](https://storybook.js.org/blog/framework-api/)
segments.sourceMdx: [![NextJS, SvelteKit, Remix and the future of Storybook](/emails/issues/127/storybook-frameworks.png)](https://storybook.js.org/blog/framework-api/)

segments.content:
* üçø [React.js - The Documentary - Trailer](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gmp0istg5xo): a documentary about React should be released in February. In the meantime you can check this 2min trailer. A nice list of guests have participated. I'm really looking forward to seeing this, and remembering the early years of React. This [parody](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ov0alO_k_1k) also made me laugh ;)
* üìñ Beta docs: [useTransition](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1598468389340585984) + [Suspense](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1598412132827435008) + [useDeferredValue](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1598414645244534784). We can sympathize with Dan Abramov who [dreams of documentation at night](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1598149838017003520) üòÖ Glad this long effort is coming to an end.
* üìú [Lessons learned: how I‚Äôd rebuild a social web app like Twitter today](https://paularmstrong.dev/blog/2022/11/28/lessons-learned-how-i-would-rebuild-twitter-today/): Paul worked on the Twitter web app. He wonders what choices he would make for it today. He would use Tailwind instead of React-Native-Web, which presents some pragmatic difficulties, and Twitter doesn't use React-Native so the cross-platform benefits are limited. He would also use a more reactive framework like SolidJS or Preact + Signals. Many other interesting points: Vite, Module Federation, Client Hints, Deno...
* üìú [React vs React Native: How Different Are They, Really?](https://echobind.com/post/react-vs-react-native-how-different-are-they): details the many similarities and differences between React (DOM) and React-Native. A good resource for web developers who might be tempted to learn React-Native and want to know how much knowledge they will be able to reuse, but also for managers looking to understand what it takes to adopt React-Native.
* üìú [Different Dimensions of Remix Deploy Targets](https://andre-landgraf.dev/blog/2022-12-03_different-dimensions-of-remix-deploy-targets): Remix can be deployed on different platforms, thanks to its adapters. This article analyzes each target platform along several dimensions and helps us to make an informed choice.
* üìú [Component Testing in Storybook](https://bradfrost.com/blog/link/component-testing-in-storybook/): Brad Frost gives his positive opinion on the latest Storybook testing features presented in [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wEa6W8uUGSA). I also agree that Jest alone is not a suitable tool for visual rendering.
* üìú [React Conditional Rendering With Type Safety and Exhaustive Checking](https://www.lloydatkinson.net/posts/2022/react-conditional-rendering-with-type-safety-and-exhaustive-checking/): React + TypeScript tip useful to know to make sure not to forget any case of an union-type (waiting for a real pattern matching support).
* üìú [How we migrated from Redux to TanStack Query and Redux Toolkit](https://tech.storyly.io/how-we-migrated-from-redux-to-tanstack-query-and-redux-toolkit-ac9be2f445be): the story of 2 quite different projects based on Redux, and migrated incrementally to distinct solutions: RTK and React-Query.
* üìú [Why you should reconsider prefetching in Remix](https://www.themosaad.com/blog/reconsider-prefetching-in-remix): an interesting reflection on the impact of a very fast but inconsistent navigation (ie sometimes slower without prefetching). I have a mixed opinion on the conclusion: we should be able to keep prefetching and make the UX consistent.
* üìú [Add rolling sessions to Remix](https://sergiodxa.com/articles/add-rolling-sessions-to-remix)
* üìú [The Children Prop Pattern in React](https://www.craftvalue.io/blog/react-children-prop-pattern)
* üé• [TanStack Router: Type safe routing and URL state management for your applications](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qUZm3gbMOeo): Tanner presents his new 100% typesafe and agnostic router. I make the [same observation as him](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1555493419128168449): the existing APIs (Next.js, React-Router) do not facilitate the creation of apps that use query-strings a lot, and a new typesafe solution is welcome.
* üé• [React Streaming In Depth! NextJS! Remix! DIY!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o3JWb04DRIs): long video that details how streaming works with React, via the Next.js and Remix frameworks. Also offers a home-made implementation (not for production).
* üé• [Remix - Roadmap Planning #1](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YSo0vKqAWtk): first public roadmapping session for the framework, as announced in [Open Development for Remix](https://remix.run/blog/open-development).
* üé• [ChatGPT refactoring php + jquery to Next.js](https://twitter.com/thekitze/status/1598414259137880066): this new AI is impressive and has devs talking a lot this week on Twitter!
* üé® [HTML + React-Three-Fiber demo](https://twitter.com/0xca0a/status/1599367266448994304): cela semble de plus en plus facile, et performant, d'int√©grer du HTML dans une scene 3D avec React-Three-Fiber.
* üê¶ [Nodejs.dev adopting Next.js?](https://twitter.com/ovflowd/status/1599417661242232832): the Node.js doc could migrate from Gatsby to Next.js
* üê¶ [React Server Components + MDX](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1598615824927002624): the impact of RSC is potentially important for content sites using MDX, like Docusaurus or Nextra ;)
* üì® [React.holiday](https://react.holiday/): ephemeral avent newsletter of 25 short emails about new features of Next.js 13
* üì¶ [Papanasi 1.0](https://twitter.com/CKGrafico/status/1597585206034169857): v1 release of this innovative UI components library. It is based on [Mitosis](https://github.com/builderio/mitosis), which allows to compile code to all frameworks at once: React, Vue, Svelte, Solid...
* üì¶ [Jotai 1.11](https://twitter.com/jotaijs/status/1598366077527810048)
* üì¶ [Gatsby 5.2](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/reference/release-notes/v5.2/)
* üì¶ [Redwood 3.5](https://github.com/redwoodjs/redwood/releases/tag/v3.5.0)

segments.content: **[JavaScriptBoard.com - Let the job find you](https://cutt.ly/C1VnflC)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[JavaScriptBoard.com - Let the job find you](https://cutt.ly/C1VnflC)**

segments.content: JavaScriptBoard.com **reverses the hiring system** and focuses on developers looking for **long-term work relationships.**
segments.sourceMdx: JavaScriptBoard.com **reverses the hiring system** and focuses on developers looking for **long-term work relationships.**

segments.content: No more browsing through LinkedIn recruiter messages and uninteresting job offers!
segments.sourceMdx: No more browsing through LinkedIn recruiter messages and uninteresting job offers!

segments.content: At JavaScriptBoard.com you sign up and only receive job offers that match YOUR requirements.
segments.sourceMdx: At JavaScriptBoard.com you sign up and only receive job offers that match YOUR requirements.

segments.content:
* 100% of the jobs have the **salary range included**.
* 100% **anonymity for developers** by default.
* **CV is not needed**. Completely optional.
* Earn \*\*$500 if you are hired \*\*through JavaScriptBoard.com!

segments.content: ## üì± React-Native
segments.sourceMdx: ## üì± React-Native {#react-native}

segments.content:
* üìä [State of React Native](https://stateofreactnative.com/): Software Mansion is preparing a survey around React-Native and invites us to contribute to the questions asked: [2022 Call for Questions](https://github.com/software-mansion/state-of-react-native/discussions/1).
* üì¶ [Tamagui v1 Release Candidate](https://tamagui.dev/blog/version-one-release-candidate): Tamagui is a promising solution based on a compiler to style its React components in a universal way (mobile and web). The move to RC marks the stabilization of the APIs.
* üì¶ [Solito v2](https://solito.dev/v2): cross-platform navigation solution. Next.js 13 support + SolitoImage component.
* üì¶ [Reanimated 3.0-rc.8](https://twitter.com/kzzzf/status/1598394289570156544): new and much more efficient implementation of Shared Values
* üì¶ [Preact-Native](https://github.com/barelyhuman/preact-native): a dev wants to run Preact with React-Native. This seems complex, and put on [stand-by](https://reaper.is/writing/20221204-decisions-and-updates-november-2022).
* üì¶ [create-react-native-library 0.27.2](https://twitter.com/satya164/status/1598774126805766144): supports RN 0.71, Fabric template...
* üì¶ [React-Native 0.71.0-RC.3](https://twitter.com/Kelset/status/1598018432229777408): 0.71 should come soon!
* üì¶ [Airbnb - Announcing Lottie 4.0 for iOS](https://medium.com/airbnb-engineering/announcing-lottie-4-0-for-ios-d4d226862a54)
* üì¶ [Maestro](https://github.com/mobile-dev-inc/maestro): end-2-end blackbox testing tool that is gaining popularity (comparable to Appium)
* üí¨ [Expo Router RFC - Shared Routes](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1598074538298048512)
* üí¨ [VisionCamera 3.0 discussion](https://github.com/mrousavy/react-native-vision-camera/issues/1376)
* üê¶ [Krzysztof Magiera - "Next version of reanimated will finally have proper stack trace support."](https://twitter.com/kzzzf/status/1598828117509910528)
* üé• [Confetti Animation with React-Native Skia](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOhYFDOEOmo)
segments.sourceMdx:
- üìä [State of React Native](https://stateofreactnative.com/): Software Mansion is preparing a survey around React-Native and invites us to contribute to the questions asked: [2022 Call for Questions](https://github.com/software-mansion/state-of-react-native/discussions/1).
- üì¶ [Tamagui v1 Release Candidate](https://tamagui.dev/blog/version-one-release-candidate): Tamagui is a promising solution based on a compiler to style its React components in a universal way (mobile and web). The move to RC marks the stabilization of the APIs.
- üì¶ [Solito v2](https://solito.dev/v2): cross-platform navigation solution. Next.js 13 support + SolitoImage component.
- üì¶ [Reanimated 3.0-rc.8](https://twitter.com/kzzzf/status/1598394289570156544): new and much more efficient implementation of Shared Values
- üì¶ [Preact-Native](https://github.com/barelyhuman/preact-native): a dev wants to run Preact with React-Native. This seems complex, and put on [stand-by](https://reaper.is/writing/20221204-decisions-and-updates-november-2022).
- üì¶ [create-react-native-library 0.27.2](https://twitter.com/satya164/status/1598774126805766144): supports RN 0.71, Fabric template...

segments.content: ## üßë‚Äçüíª Jobs
segments.sourceMdx: ## üßë‚Äçüíª Jobs {#jobs}

segments.content: üßë‚Äçüíº [**Product Engineer at Causal, Remote/London/NY, $150-250k**](https://jobs.lever.co/causal-app/4acaafbe-ef3d-45a6-bbe6-687c022d727c?lever-origin=applied\&lever-source%5B%5D=thisweekinreact.com)
segments.sourceMdx: üßë‚Äçüíº [**Product Engineer at Causal, Remote/London/NY, $150-250k**](https://jobs.lever.co/causal-app/4acaafbe-ef3d-45a6-bbe6-687c022d727c?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=thisweekinreact.com)

segments.content: Causal is a Series A Startup (backed by Coatue/Accel) building an all-in-one tool for working with numbers and visualizing data. We're looking for strong React engineers who can solve difficult UX/performance challenges.
segments.sourceMdx: Causal is a Series A Startup (backed by Coatue/Accel) building an all-in-one tool for working with numbers and visualizing data. We're looking for strong React engineers who can solve difficult UX/performance challenges.

segments.content: üßë‚Äçüíº [**Callstack - Senior React Native Developer - Fully Remote, PLN 21-32k net on B2B, monthly**](https://www.callstack.com/senior-react-native-developer)
segments.sourceMdx: üßë‚Äçüíº [**Callstack - Senior React Native Developer - Fully Remote, PLN 21-32k net on B2B, monthly**](https://www.callstack.com/senior-react-native-developer)

segments.content: Do you want to work on the world's most used apps? Would you like to co-create the React Native technology? Join the Callstack team of React & React Native leaders. Check our website for more details. We are looking forward to seeing your application - show us what you've got!
segments.sourceMdx: Do you want to work on the world's most used apps? Would you like to co-create the React Native technology? Join the Callstack team of React & React Native leaders. Check our website for more details. We are looking forward to seeing your application - show us what you've got!

segments.content: üßë‚Äçüíº [**G2i - 100% Remote React Native Jobs**](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i/status/1563204813881425926?s=20\&t=ArRLC77BpRwXXCdx8fnUqw)
segments.sourceMdx: üßë‚Äçüíº [**G2i - 100% Remote React Native Jobs**](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i/status/1563204813881425926?s=20&t=ArRLC77BpRwXXCdx8fnUqw)

segments.content: We have several roles open for developers focused on React Native! Pay is \~160k plus 10% bonus. You must have production experience with RN and be based in the US. DM [@gabe\_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) to learn more and don't forget to mention This Week in React.

segments.content: **[Updates from the 93rd TC39 meeting](https://dev.to/hemanth/updates-from-the-93rd-tc39-meeting-2n8f)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Updates from the 93rd TC39 meeting](https://dev.to/hemanth/updates-from-the-93rd-tc39-meeting-2n8f)**

segments.content: Some very nice proposals for JavaScript have progressed last week, in particular:
segments.sourceMdx: Some very nice proposals for JavaScript have progressed last week, in particular:

segments.content:
* [Set Methods](https://twitter.com/robpalmer2/status/1597947853598785537) in stage 3: union, intersection, difference... üôå
* [Iterator Helpers](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-iterator-helpers) in stage 3: map, flatMap, filter, reduce...
* Intl APIs that continue to complement each other.
segments.sourceMdx:
- [Set Methods](https://twitter.com/robpalmer2/status/1597947853598785537) in stage 3: union, intersection, difference... üôå
- [Iterator Helpers](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-iterator-helpers) in stage 3: map, flatMap, filter, reduce...
- Intl APIs that continue to complement each other.
